attribute-definition.description: The token exchanged within the SendCart API call to display the checkout iframe.
A unique hash to verify the contents of the Basket have not changed during the Global-e checkout.
Renders an alternative URL in main navigation. Uses demandware content url notation. For example: $url('Account-Show')$ or normal urls http://xchange.demandware.com

Used to define the content asset used to populate a grid page banner for a category. This value is applied to all sub category navigation (cascading) if no specific catBannerID has been defined for a sub category.
Use this attribute to apply custom styles for this category.

Used to define if/when the Compare feature is to be visualized in the storefront based on navigation. If enableCompare = FALSE, no Compare checkboxes will be displayed in the grid view. If enableCompare = TRUE, the category (and its children) will support the Compare feature.
Denotes whether products have a link to an additional resource on their pdp.
Which way to orient the menu and optional header menu HTML. Vertical will list all in one line. Horizontal will list in columns.

attribute-definition.display-name: Label to be shown on global navigation

attribute-definition.description: The maximum number of columns to separate subcategories into on the desktop global navigation menu.

If checked, the category will not be displayed in the launch pad section of Tier1, 2 and BU Landing Page. if it is a top level category and checked, the category will not be displayed on the navigation, Homepage and Error pages' Category Navigation section. Applicable only for Tablet.

Used to indicate that a category (such as Mens -> Footwear -> Boots) will display in the roll over navigation. A sub-category only shows if also the parent category is marked as showInMenu. Up to three category levels are shown in roll over navigation.
Include Sitemap HTML

Used to define the content asset ID of the Size Chart that is appropriate for products whose PRIMARY category is the associated category (and its children). Whenever a product detail page (or quick view) is rendered, the Size Chart link is populated based on the value of this attribute for the products primary categorization. If not defined, NO size chart link is displayed.
Image used on either the top or bottom slot on the category landing pages.

attribute-definition.display-name: Bazaarvoice Ask & Answer Default Display Code
attribute-definition.description: The display code for your Bazaarvoice A&A implementation. For example: 1234-en_us

This preference value is expected to be valid client-side javascript. The Bazaarvoice cartridge will wrap this javascript in a function(){...} block. Your code must return a valid Bazaarvoice DisplayCode to be used for display and submission of A&A. This preference exists so that you may customize which DisplayCode is used based upon data available client-side. Typically this is used to select a locale-specific DisplayCode. In the event of an error processing this javascript or that it returns nothing, the default display code specified above will be used.

Display Code Mapping: The display code for your Bazaarvoice implementation. Can be a single display code, or a mapping of a DW Locale ID to BV display code. Format: [“DW Locale ID”:][“BV Display Code base[-locale]”] Valid examples: 1234 1234-en_us “en”:”1234-en_us” “fr_CA”:”1234-fr_ca”

This preference value is expected to be valid client-side javascript. The Bazaarvoice cartridge will wrap this javascript in a function(){...} block. Your code must return a value of "mobile" or an empty string, "", depending on whether or not you want to set the displayType for A&A display to a mobile device or for a full browser client. This preference exists so that you may customize which displayType is used based upon data available client-side. See your Bazaarvoice Implementation manual for further information on the displayType configuration parameter.

The Bazaarvoice JavaScript onEvent callback enables you to track certain actions that occur with Bazaarvoice UI components. For example, the event callback can be used to pass tracking information into your web analytics system or otherwise change the behavior of your page depending on the information it passes back about the User-Generated-Content available on the page. This code will be wrapped in a javascript function(json){...} block. See your Bazaarvoice Implementation manual for further information.

This preference value is expected to be a valid client-side javascript. In the event that BV Q&A are displayed behind a tab, this javascript will be used by BV to open the tab in the event that the "Read all Q&A" link is clicked by an end user.
The sub domain name for the Bazaarvoice Ask & Answer.
The domain from which bvapi.js is hosted. For example: <clientname>.ugc.bazaarvoice.com
The email address of the Bazaarvoice administrator. This is where feed notifications are sent.
All notifications for BV-related DW job schedules will be sent to this email address.

With BV Hosted authentication method, users click the "write a review" link on a product page and authenticate by using just their email address provided in content submission page. With DW Site authentication, users are redirected to login to the DW site before the user can access the BV submission page.

attribute-definition.display-name: Bazaarvoice Active Profiles Default Display Code
attribute-definition.description: The display code for your Bazaarvoice Active Profiles implementation. For example: 1234-en_us

This preference value is expected to be valid client-side javascript. The Bazaarvoice cartridge will wrap this javascript in a function(){...} block. Your code must return a valid Bazaarvoice DisplayCode to be used for display and submission of ActiveProfiles. This preference exists so that you may customize which DisplayCode is used based upon data available client-side. Typically this is used to select a locale-specific DisplayCode. In the event of an error processing this javascript or that it returns nothing, the default display code specified above will be used.

This preference value is expected to be valid client-side javascript. The Bazaarvoice cartridge will wrap this javascript in a function(){...} block. Your code must return a value of "mobile" or an empty string, "", depending on whether or not you want to set the displayType for Active Profiles display and submission to a mobile device or for a full browser client. This preference exists so that you may customize which displayType is used based upon data available client-side. See your Bazaarvoice Implementation manual for further information on the displayType configuration parameter.

The Bazaarvoice JavaScript onEvent callback enables you to track certain actions that occur with Bazaarvoice UI components. For example, the event callback can be used to pass tracking information into your web analytics system or otherwise change the behavior of your page depending on the information it passes back about the User-Generated-Content available on the page. This code will be wrapped in a javascript function(json){...} block. See your Bazaarvoice Implementation manual for further information.

By default, Bazaarvoice code will always render the "Edit My Profile" link on the Active Profiles display container page, regardless of whether or not the current visitor is logged in or whether or not they are viewing their own profile page. Enabling this option will render a link on the container page outside of the injected code that will only be visible if the current visitor is logged in and viewing their own profile page. When this option is enabled, it is advised that the "Edit My Profile" link that is injected by Bazaarvoice be disabled. Contact your Implementation Engineer to have the link removed.
The sub domain name for the Bazaarvoice Active Profiles.
SEO Cloud key value as defined in your BV platform account. This key is only required if Cloud SEO is enabled.
Client Name as defined in your BV platform account
Deployment Zone Name as defined in your BV platform account
The display code for your Bazaarvoice implementation.
The domain from which your store will be hosted and Bazaarvoice content will be injected.
Turn on Bazaarvoice Ask & Answer. This will enable display of A&A content on your product and category pages.
Turn on BV Questions & Answers. This will enable display of Q&A content on your product pages. See documentation for additional steps that must be completed for this feature to take effect.
Turn on the BV Pixel tag on the DW purchase transaction (checkout) page. See documentation for additional steps that must be completed for this feature to take effect.

Turn on the BV SEO solution. This will include SEO-friendly content (located in the BV SEO cloud) in your product pages. See documentation for additional steps that must be completed for this feature to take effect.
Turn on Inline Ratings. This will enable importing ratings feeds from the Bazaarvoice SFTP server and display them as inline star ratings in search results.

Turn on BV JS-based inline ratings. This will enable display of product rating statistics on your category and search results pages. See documentation for additional steps that must be completed for this feature to take effect.
Turn on Product Feed generation. This will enable generation of a product feed to be sent to the Bazaarvoice SFTP server.

Turn on Product Feed generation. This will enable generation of a product feed to be sent to the BV FTP server. See documentation for additional steps to setup a scheduled job in DW for this feature to take effect.

Turn on Purchase Feed generation. This will enable generation of a purchase feed to be sent to the Bazaarvoice FTP server to be used to send post-interaction emails to your customers, in order to solicit review submission.

Turn on Purchase Feed generation. This will enable generation of a purchase feed to be sent to the BV FTP server to be used to send post-interaction emails to your customers in order to solicit review submission. See documentation for additional steps to setup a scheduled job in DW for this feature to take effect.
Turn on Bazaarvoice Ratings & Reviews. This will enable display of R&R content on your product pages.
Turn on display of Bazaarvoice Ratings & Reviews Comments. This will enable display of R&R comments on your product pages.
Turn on BV Ratings & Reviews. This will enable display of R&R content on your product pages. See documentation for additional steps that must be completed for this feature to take effect.
Turn on Bazaarvoice Stories. This will enable display of Stories content on your product and category pages.
Turn on display of Bazaarvoice Stories Comments. This will enable display of Stories comments on your product and category pages.
Turn on Smart SEO. This will enable importing Smart SEO archives from the Bazaarvoice SFTP server and present them to search engine crawlers on product pages.
Key used to encode Bazaarvoice user authentication string. Provided by your Implementation Engineer
Key used to encode BV user authentication string. Only required when DW Site Authentication is selected. Defined in your BV platform account.
BV environment that this DW instance type is integrating with

attribute-definition.display-name: Bazaarvoice Product Feed Export File Name
Facebook cross-domain channel policy file URL
attribute-definition.description: For example, http://www.yourdomain.com/path/to/facebook_xd_receiver.htm
The domain from which your store will be hosted and Bazaarvoice content will be injected. For example: yourdomain.com

Colon separated value pairs that define how DW Locales are mapped to BV Locales. DW Locales must be enabled in the current DW Site. BV Locales must be enabled within your BV platform acocunt. Format: ["(DW Locale ID)":]"(BV Locale)"

This is the Image Size type used in the feed. The value must match an existing Image Size type. If Image Type custom site preference is set to anything other than medium, then when the feed generator discovers a product that does not have that size type defined, the medium image will be used. If no medium image is set for that product, no image URL will be added in the feed

This is the Image Size type used in the feed. The value must match an existing Image Size type. If Image Type custom site preference is set to anything other than medium, then when the feed generator discovers a product that does not have that size type defined, the medium image will be used. If no medium image is set for that product, no image URL will be added in the feed

attribute-definition.display-name: Bazaarvoice Product Feed Export File Name

attribute-definition.description: This is the Image Size type used in the feed. The value must match an existing Image Size type. If Image Type custom site preference is set to anything other than medium, then when the feed generator discovers a product that does not have that size type defined, the medium image will be used. If no medium image is set for that product, no image URL will be added in the feed

This is the Image Size type used in the feed. The value must match an existing Image Size type. If Image Type custom site preference is set to anything other than medium, then when the feed generator discovers a product that does not have that size type defined, the medium image will be used. If no medium image is set for that product, no image URL will be added in the feed
The Hostname for Bazaarvoice user profiles

attribute-definition.display-name: Days to Wait after Trigger Event
attribute-definition.description: This value represents the number of days to wait after the triggering event until including the transaction in the exported feed.

This is the filename of the exported purchase feed xml sent to Bazaarvoice SFTP servers. A timestamp will be automatically appended to the filename using a YYYY-MM-DD format. Example: bazaarvoice-order-data-2012-12-31.xml

attribute-definition.display-name: Number of Days Worth of Transactions in Past to Retrieve
attribute-definition.description: This value represents the number of days of historical transactions to include in the feed. This cartridge keeps track of which Orders have already been included in a previous purchase feed in an effort to avoid sending duplicate emails to customers for the same order. This number should be larger than how long it typically takes to send out a shipment.
Typically, this should be "/ppe/inbox".
This determines whether to use the purchase date or ship date when calculating which purchases to include in the purchase feed.
This determines whether to use the purchase date or ship date when calculating which purchases to include in the purchase feed.

This preference value is expected to be a valid client-side javascript. In the event that Bazaarvoice Q&A are displayed behind a tab, this javascript will be used by Bazaarvoice to open the tab in the event that the "Read all Q&A" link is clicked by an end user.

attribute-definition.display-name: Bazaarvoice Ratings & Reviews Default Display Code
attribute-definition.description: The display code for your Bazaarvoice R&R implementation. For example: 1234-en_us

This preference value is expected to be valid client-side javascript. The Bazaarvoice cartridge will wrap this javascript in a function(){...} block. Your code must return a valid Bazaarvoice DisplayCode to be used for display and submission of Reviews. This preference exists so that you may customize which DisplayCode is used based upon data available client-side. Typically this is used to select a locale-specific DisplayCode. In the event of an error processing this javascript or that it returns nothing, the default display code specified above will be used.

Display Code Mapping: The display code for your Bazaarvoice implementation. Can be a single display code, or a mapping of a DW Locale ID to BV display code. Format: [“DW Locale ID”:][“BV Display Code base[-locale]”] Valid examples: 1234 1234-en_us “en”:”1234-en_us” “fr_CA”:”1234-fr_ca”

This preference value is expected to be valid client-side javascript. The Bazaarvoice cartridge will wrap this javascript in a function(){...} block. Your code must return a value of "mobile" or an empty string, "", depending on whether or not you want to set the displayType for R&R display to a mobile device or for a full browser client. This preference exists so that you may customize which displayType is used based upon data available client-side. Contact your Bazaarvoice Implementation Engineer for further information on the displayType configuration parameter.
The host name for the Bazaarvoice Ratings and Reviews.

The Bazaarvoice JavaScript onEvent callback enables you to track certain actions that occur with Bazaarvoice UI components. For example, the event callback can be used to pass tracking information into your web analytics system or otherwise change the behavior of your page depending on the information it passes back about the User-Generated-Content available on the page. This code will be wrapped in a javascript function(json){...} block. See your Bazaarvoice Implementation manual for further information.

This preference value is expected to be a valid client-side javascript. In the event that Bazaarvoice reviews are displayed behind a tab, this javascript will be used by Bazaarvoice to open the tab in the event that the "Read all reviews" link is clicked by an end user.

attribute-definition.display-name: Show Reviews Tab Javascript function (product page)
attribute-definition.description: This preference value is expected to be a valid client-side javascript. In the event that Bazaarvoice reviews are displayed behind a tab, this javascript will be used by Bazaarvoice to open the tab in the event that the "Read all reviews" link is clicked by an end user.
The sub domain name for the Bazaarvoice Ratings and Reviews.
The display code for your Bazaarvoice Stories implementation. For example: 1234-en_us

This preference value is expected to be valid client-side javascript. The Bazaarvoice cartridge will wrap this javascript in a function(){...} block. Your code must return a valid Bazaarvoice DisplayCode to be used for display and submission of Stories. This preference exists so that you may customize which DisplayCode is used based upon data available client-side. Typically this is used to select a locale-specific DisplayCode. In the event of an error processing this javascript or that it returns nothing, the default display code specified above will be used.

Display Code Mapping: The display code for your Bazaarvoice implementation. Can be a single display code, or a mapping of a DW Locale ID to BV display code. Format: [“DW Locale ID”:][“BV Display Code base[-locale]”] Valid examples: 1234 1234-en_us “en”:”1234-en_us” “fr_CA”:”1234-fr_ca”

This preference value is expected to be valid client-side javascript. The Bazaarvoice cartridge will wrap this javascript in a function(){...} block, therefore your code must return a value of "show_grid" or "show_stories" depending on whether or not you want to display the Stories grid or list views. This preference exists so that you may customize which view is displayed based upon other data in the browser. "show_grid" is the default display type if nothing is provided here.

This preference value is expected to be valid client-side javascript. The Bazaarvoice cartridge will wrap this javascript in a function(){...} block. Your code must return a value of "mobile" or an empty string, "", depending on whether or not you want to set the displayType for stories display to a mobile device or for a full browser client. This preference exists so that you may customize which displayType is used based upon data available client-side. See your Bazaarvoice Implementation manual for further information on the displayType configuration parameter.

The Bazaarvoice JavaScript onEvent callback enables you to track certain actions that occur with Bazaarvoice UI components. For example, the event callback can be used to pass tracking information into your web analytics system or otherwise change the behavior of your page depending on the information it passes back about the User-Generated-Content available on the page. This code will be wrapped in a javascript function(json){...} block. See your Bazaarvoice Implementation manual for further information.

This preference value is expected to be a valid client-side javascript. In the event that Bazaarvoice stories are displayed behind a tab, this javascript will be used by Bazaarvoice to open the tab in the event that the "Read all stories" link is clicked by an end user.

If you have enabled SmartSEO, this preference determines which type of pre-rendered content will be injected into the page. Valid options are "stories" and "storiesgrid", corresponding to the list and grid views of stories, respectively.
The sub domain name for the Bazaarvoice Stories.
This is the filename of the Smart SEO zip archive on Bazaarvoice SFTP servers. Usually this value is bv_client_smartseo.zip, with "client" replaced with the customer name.

attribute-definition.display-name: Bazaarvoice Smart SEO Maximum Content Staleness
attribute-definition.description: This value represents the maximum age in days to use cached content if new content is not available on import.

Bazaarvoice staging URL string. This is used to append the bvstaging to Bazaarvoice URLs. Its value should be set to "/" for the production context and "/bvstaging" for the sandbox and staging contexts.

This preference value is expected to be valid client-side javascript. The Bazaarvoice cartridge will wrap this javascript in a function(){...} block. Your code must return a value of "mobile" or an empty string, "", depending on whether or not you want to set the displayType for the reviews submission container to a mobile device or for a full browser client. This preference exists so that you may customize which displayType is used based upon data available client-side. See your Bazaarvoice Implementation manual for further information on the displayType configuration parameter.

The URL of the Bazaarvoice review submission page. This should point to the Start node of the SubmissionContainer pipeline. For example: http://yourdomain.com/on/demandware.store/Sites-SiteGenesis-Site/default/Bazaarvoice-SubmissionContainer

attribute-definition.display-name: Order statuses for which cancellation is unavailable
URL where tracking no would be appended to get tracking URL

attribute-definition.description: Flag to turn on/off the Ireland specific code changes. set TRUE, if the changes are required for Ireland specific changes.

attribute-definition.description: This preference will be used to fetch the URL of the server from where we have to get the Conversion details report.
This attribute will be used to capture the name of the variable used as 'endDate' in coversion report.
This attribute will be used to capture the name of the variable used as 'endTime' in coversion report.
This attribute will be used to capture the name of the variable used as 'merchantID' in coversion report.
This attribute will be used to capture the name of the variable used as 'password' in coversion report.
This attribute will be used to capture the name of the variable used as 'startDate' in coversion report.
This attribute will be used to capture the name of the variable used as 'startTime' in coversion report.
This attribute will be used to capture the name of the variable used as 'username' in coversion detail report.
check to enable disable coockie policy

Default Country Code for Store Searches
this json will contain mapping between for country which require zipcode
This field will be used in Cybersource-ChangeLocaletoDefault, value of the default locale will be picked from this field to convert the current locale to the default one.
This preference will have the URL of development CS end point.
This preference will have the URL of production CS end point.
This preference will have the URL of test CS end point.
This attribute will store the Cybersource password for making the request for conversion report.
This preference will be used to set the value of 'orgID' which will go to CS for deviceFingerPrint

attribute-definition.description: Enable Collect Code
This Boolean toggles the option for infinite scrolling or pagination from within the search grid.
This Boolean enables the use of multi currency in the storefront
The attribute is used to enable/disable Multi-Shipment Checkout for each site via BM.
Preference whether to show the archived orders button on order history page
This Boolean enables the storefront ability to perform tasks related to in store orders
Boolean value to enable or disable restricting products at variant level

To enable Enhanced Search Suggestions set this site preference to True and set the Search Preferences>Search Suggestion Settings > Search Suggestions option to Enabled. To enable the older version of search suggestions, set this site preference to False and set the Search Preferences>Search Suggestion Settings > Search Suggestions option to Enabled. The Search Preferences>Search Suggestion option is set to Disabled by default.
The application ID that will be used with Facebook Connect.
The check box used to determine if the Facebook part of the registration form can communicate with Facebook when registering customers in the storefront.

The pipeline used to redirect from Facebook to an internal pipeline - used in the facebookregistration.isml template. This is a pipeline, so the format must be <pipeline>-<subpipeline>, for example, Account-Connect.
File path in Impex for Offline Products BM extension
Will force the store base currency for the listed countries when sending order to Global-e
This setting will force fixed price for varients without fixed price if they have a sibling variant with fixed price applied
Whether to add Notes to Order on any Global-e update or not.
The ViewType of the image that will be sent to Global-e
The timeout for the API calls to Global-e (ms).
The base URL for Global-e API communication.
The source Domain for Global-e Client JS.
The Merchant Id that is used to load the welcome popup template.
The source URL for Global-e Client JS.
The domain for which the Global-e cookies are registered.
The lifetime of the cookie (in seconds) default is one week.
Name of the main global-e cookie holding the country culture and currency selected.
Is logging of Global-e ProductCountryS responses enabled
Specifies if Global-e integration is enabled
The timeout for the API calls to Global-e that are performed from within a frontend operation (in ms).
If true loads all products from catalog to Global-e when intially called.
The GIUD that is used for the Global-e Merchant account.
The Id of the html element used to hold the custom content in the switcher popup
If true then searches for the "globale-switcher-popup" asets by country and includes them in the globale popup
The Id of the html element used to hold the custom content in the welcome popup
If true then searches for the "globale-welcome-popup" asets by country and includes them in the globale popup
A list of semicolon (;) separated IP numbers, that can access the Merchant API.
Http Host Redirection
Http Path Redirection
Countries where iDeal is applicable
Attribute to identify if new flex build is active

attribute-definition.display-name: Last time of successful export of orders for loyalty system

attribute-definition.description: List of all the valid and allowed locales. this is used to create SEO "rel=alternate" tags for all the allowed locales

attribute-definition.display-name: Mappings for a locale to a specific URL
Regular Expression for a valid Loyalty Card in a given country
attribute-definition.description: A pairing between country ISO code and the regular expression for a valid loyalty card in that country. If a country's ISO code is not present in this list, it is assumed that that country does not support loyalty cards.
The name of the property containing Loyalty Code if exists (optional)
Countries where mister cash is applicable
Google MAP API key
This preferences is used to set max element for exact target job.
This is not for the maximum suggestion user will see on storefront, its used for query the database. Maximum possible value is 10
Merchant's Local Country Code

attribute-definition.display-name: Min Hour value For CategoryService Execution

attribute-definition.description: Get the API key from the Google Maps Dashboard https://console.cloud.google.com/home/dashboard

Enter Google Maps API version
3 - stable version blank - experimental version 3.31 - specific version
Site for mobile
Maximum number of days a product is on the site for and is still considered to be "new"

attribute-definition.display-name: Number of Rows For PLP Content

attribute-definition.description: Order Channel for Website

attribute-definition.display-name: Interval between current order and next order

attribute-definition.description: orderEmailEndTime
orderEmailStartTime
Order Export File Location with respect to "src" folder. e.g. if the location is "<ImpexLocation>\src\orderUpdate\FranceSite", this field should have the value as "orderUpdate\FranceSite"
Allows you to switch to Old calling functionality if not enabled.
list of cards for which payer authentication is enabled
If enabled iscache tag will use the if attribute for predictive sort.
Used for setting up the MY_PREFERRED_COUNTRY cookie value
The name of the property to check against ProductClassCode for coefficient rate
The pattern of Product Code Secondary propery if exists (optional)
The name of the custom property containing ProductGroupCode if exists (optional)
